Liquidity Fragmentation.Explanation: Liquidity fragmentation refers to how capital is distributed across the pool's price range. Wombat uses dynamic rebalancing to maintain even coverage, while Uniswap splits liquidity across price ranges due to x*y=k model.
Liquidity Fragmentation.Winner: Wombat – better capital spread and dynamic response to price

Computation Cost (Gas / Smart Contract L.Explanation: Computation cost includes operation count (proxy for gas) and how much state data is fetched/updated in each transaction. Wombat’s dynamic operations increase cost but provide tighter peg.

Wombat.State Data Accessed: Coverage ratios, fee multipliers, price tweaks, rebase targets
Wombat.Complexity: High – several real-time adjustments per swap

Uniswap.Gas Optimization: Highly gas efficient, simple swap logic

Computation Cost (Gas / Smart Contract L.Winner: Uniswap – much simpler and gas efficient

Capital Efficiency.Explanation: Capital efficiency measures how well liquidity earns yield with minimal slippage and loss. Wombat mitigates impermanent loss via repeg and smoother pricing.

Wombat.Impermanent Loss Mitigation: Yes – via dynamic coverage, smoothing, repeg

Capital Efficiency.Winner: Wombat – better IL protection and lower slippage overall
